content.question: Which of the following statements is true?

choices.label: The series <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of, open parenthesis, negative 1, close parenthesis, raised to the n plus 1 power, times, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator the square root of n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> diverges by the alternating series test.

The series <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of, open parenthesis, negative 1, close parenthesis, raised to the n plus 1 power, times, the fraction with numerator 4 times the square root of n, and denominator 2 plus the square root of n, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><msqrt><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><msqrt><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> converges by the alternating series test.

The series <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of, open parenthesis, negative 1, close parenthesis, raised to the n plus 1 power, times, the fraction with numerator, the cosine of, open parenthesis, n times pi, close parenthesis, and denominator n squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfrac><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>n</mi><mi>π</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> converges by the alternating series test.

The series <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of, open parenthesis, negative 1, close parenthesis, raised to the n plus 1 power, times the fraction with numerator 4 n, and denominator 9 plus n squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> converges by the alternating series test.

content.answer: The series <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of, open parenthesis, negative 1, close parenthesis, raised to the n plus 1 power, times the fraction with numerator 4 n, and denominator 9 plus n squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> converges by the alternating series test.
